text: Svirsk () is a town in Irkutsk Oblast, Russia, located on the left bank of the Angara River northwest of Irkutsk. Population: 21,000 (1974). ==History== Svirsk was granted town status in 1949. ==Administrative and municipal status== Within the framework of administrative divisions, it is incorporated as the Town of SvirskCharter of Irkutsk Oblast—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division, the Town of Svirsk is incorporated as Svirsk Urban Okrug.Law #104-oz ==Sport== Nikita Tyukhay from Svirsk is training Chinese boys and girls in bandy as well as China national bandy team.CHN - China ==References== ===Notes=== ===Sources=== * * Category:Cities and towns in Irkutsk Oblast
title: Svirsk
